timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason we were using -all before? AFAICT it looks like the difference is  -all includes docs and source code, which we should be fine without
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText: I reverted this just to keep it the same. -bin is a significantly smaller download.
replies.author: runningcode

timeline.bodyText: I'm a little wary of this. The blog post does say its ready for production use... but I'm wondering if we should just let individuals try it themselves until it's enabled by default.
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit

replies.bodyText:
I trust the Gradle team when they say that it is ready for production use. They use it themselves in the Gradle build: https://github.com/gradle/gradle/blob/master/gradle.properties#L14
Happy to remove it if you feel it isn't safe.
replies.author: runningcode

replies.bodyText: Ok I'm fine with keeping it, it's easy enough to revert in the unlikely case it does end up causing issues.
replies.author: TheNeuralBit
